title: Staff Defensive Cyber Engineer
content:
Get to know Okta
Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.The engineering team inside Okta’s Defensive Cyber Operations (DCO) organisation is seeking a DevOps focused individual to join an existing and growing team.
These security-minded software engineers have the responsibility to build, maintain, and reliably operate the tools and applications used in the day-to-day mission of detecting and responding to  threats against Okta and its customers. Ideal candidates will have significant experience both in building serverless applications as well as maintaining them in a production environment. They should be able to speak to, and give examples, of well architected design choices and implementations. Python is the predominant language used by DCO and candidates must be comfortable using it effectively.
This position is part of the internal security department and experience working in operation security is strongly desired. Examples include, but limited to, detection engineering, SOC analyst, and security engineer.
What you’ll be doing:

Work with a distributed global team.
Efficiently configure and manage the generation, shipping, ETL, and ingestion of data sources required for providing for detection and response.
Build and enhance applications to generate detection signals and enrichment to identify potential threats.
Partner with members of the detection and response team to enhance and scale a security alert pipeline.
Deploy and maintain operational efficiency of tools and systems used across DCO.
Maintain internal tooling efficacy with observability, metrics, and quality of service alerts.
Identify and implement automation solutions to reduce the friction of the DCO team and their mission.
Collaborate with peers over architecture design and code views.
Minimal UX/UI development is expected for this position.

What this position is not:

Writing security detections or incident response
Application security, dedicated code reviews, or compliance focused
Data scientist or machine learning

Desired background:

Production and critical app development in Python, Golang or Rust
Experience architecting and developing serverless applications in AWS
Experience working with infrastructure as code and developing CI/CI pipelines. Terraform is currently used heavily. 
Container development in EKS or ECS and ability to explain security concepts for containers
Familiarity with ETL/ ITL pipelines 
6-8 years of combined experience in software development, DevOps, SRE or security operations
Experience implementing security best practices with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
